messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] FL Unschooling friendly umbrella
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Wendy.  That looks like just the thing.  I don t live in  Florida, but my friend does, and she has had her fill of religious covering  schools. Thanks
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Wendy. That looks like just the thing. I don't live in Florida,
but my friend does, and she has had her fill of religious covering schools.

Thanks to everyone else who replied, too.

Karen

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] FL Unschooling friendly umbrella
messages.msgSnippet: Have you tried Florida Unschoolers?  They may not be accepting new  members but it s worth a try.  We belong and the requirements are  minimal.  If they are
messages.messageBody:
Have you tried Florida Unschoolers? They may not be accepting new members
but it's worth a try. We belong and the requirements are minimal. If they
are not accepting new members, perhaps Nance (the lady in charge) can point you
in the right direction. Go here for the contact info:
_http://www.fldoe.org/private_school_listing/schoolreport.asp?id=43_
(http://www.fldoe.org/private_school_listing/schoolreport.asp?id=43)

Good luck!

Wendy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
You might check Natural Learning Alternative. It's in Florida. E-mail me
off list and I can give you the address and e-mail information.

Gail

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] FL Unschooling friendly umbrella
messages.msgSnippet: I m not sure what a covering school is, but I know that there is a sister Sudbury Valley School in Florida that has few requirements (you have to show up by
messages.messageBody:
I'm not sure what a "covering" school is, but I know that there is a sister
Sudbury Valley School in Florida that has few requirements (you have to show
up by 11:00am and stay for at least four hours). The one we visited in
Massachusetts was very fun, completely open in every way (except the above
requirement) and wasn't expensive relative to other private schools. I don't
have time to look it up right now, but wanted to give you info in case you
wanted to link it.

Good Luck,
Jacki
-----Original Message-----
From: tuckervill2@... [mailto:tuckervill2@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 2004 7:49 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] FL Unschooling friendly umbrella


I'm looking for a covering school in Florida that has very few
requirements
and is inexpensive and is accepting new members.

If you know of one, would you pass it on?

Karen
